generated_recipes.sft_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Black Bean Tacos",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "time": "30m",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup black beans, cooked",
    "2 ripe avocados, diced",
    "1/4 cup chopped cilantro",
    "2 lime, juiced",
    "1 tortilla"
  ],
  "steps": [
    "Preheat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil and sauté the chopped cilantro for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.",
    "Add the cooked black beans to the pan and stir to combine with the cilantro. Cook for 2-3 minutes until heated through.",
    "Cut the tortilla into quarters and warm them on a dry pan for 30 seconds to make them pliable.",
    "Assemble the tacos by spooning the black bean mixture onto a tortilla, followed by a slice of avocado and a squeeze of lime juice.",
    "Serve immediately and enjoy!"
  ]
}
generated_recipes.dpo_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Black Bean Tacos",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup black beans, cooked",
    "2 ripe avocados, diced",
    "1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped",
    "2 tablespoons lime juice",
    "1 tablespoon olive oil",
    "1 teaspoon cumin",
    "1 teaspoon chili powder",
    "1/2 teaspoon paprika",
    "1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper",
    "Salt and pepper, to taste",
    "4 corn tortillas"
  ],
  "steps": [
    "Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin, chili powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.",
    "Add the cooked black beans to the pan and stir to combine with the spice mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes.",
    "Warm the tortillas by wrapping them in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds.",
    "Assemble the tacos by spooning the black bean mixture onto a tortilla and topping with diced avocado, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.",
    "Serve immediately and enjoy!"
  ]
}

generated_recipes.sft_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Burrito Bowl",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "time": "25m",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup pinto beans (cooked)",
    "2 cups cooked rice",
    "1/2 cup salsa",
    "1 tortilla",
    "1/4 cup chopped onion",
    "1/4 cup chopped bell pepper",
    "1 tablespoon cumin",
    "1 teaspoon chili powder",
    "1/4 teaspoon paprika",
    "1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)",
    "Salt and pepper to taste",
    "Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish"
  ],
  "steps": [
    "Preheat a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and bell pepper and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.",
    "Add the cumin, chili powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper (if using) and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.",
    "Add the cooked pinto beans and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.",
    "Warm the tortilla by wrapping it in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds.",
    "Assemble the burrito bowl by spooning the bean and salsa mixture onto the tortilla, topping with cooked rice, and garnishing with fresh cilantro.",
    "Serve immediately and enjoy!"
  ]
}
generated_recipes.dpo_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Pinto Bean Burrito Bowl",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "time": "30m",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup pinto beans, cooked",
    "2 cups cooked rice",
    "1/2 cup salsa",
    "4 tortilla, whole wheat or corn",
    "1/2 avocado, diced",
    "1/4 cup chopped cilantro",
    "1 lime, juiced",
    "1 tsp cumin",
    "1 tsp chili powder",
    "1/2 tsp paprika",
    "Salt, to taste"
  ],
  "steps": [
    "Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 tsp of oil and sauté 1 minced onion until translucent. Add the cumin, chili powder, and paprika. Cook for 1 minute.",
    "Add the cooked pinto beans, cooked rice, and diced avocado to the pan. Stir to combine.",
    "Add 1/2 cup of salsa to the pan and stir to combine. Cook for 2-3 minutes.",
    "Warm the tortillas by wrapping them in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds.",
    "Assemble the burrito bowls by placing the bean and rice mixture onto a tortilla, topping with diced avocado, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice. Serve immediately."
  ],
  "note": "This recipe is a vegan twist on a classic burrito bowl. The addition of avocado adds creaminess and healthy fats, while the salsa provides a burst of flavor."
}

generated_recipes.sft_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Nachos",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "time": "30m",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup corn (fresh or frozen, thawed)",
    "2 ripe avocados, diced",
    "1/4 cup cilantro, chopped",
    "1/2 cup tortilla chips",
    "1 tablespoon lime juice"
  ],
  "steps": [
    "Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Arrange the tortilla chips in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 5-7 minutes or until crispy.",
    "In a large bowl, mash the avocado using a fork until it's mostly smooth. Stir in the chopped cilantro, lime juice, and a pinch of salt.",
    "Spoon the mashed avocado mixture over the tortilla chips. Top with the corn.",
    "Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the avocado is heated through.",
    "Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. Serve immediately and enjoy!"
  ]
}
generated_recipes.dpo_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Nachos",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "time": "30m",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup cooked black beans (canned or cooked from scratch)",
    "1 ripe avocado, sliced",
    "1/4 cup vegan salsa",
    "1/4 cup chopped cilantro",
    "1/2 cup tortilla chips",
    "1 lime, juiced",
    "1 tsp cumin",
    "1 tsp chili powder",
    "1/2 tsp paprika"
  ],

    "Top with sliced avocado and chopped cilantro.",

  ],

}

generated_recipes.sft_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Mexican Platter",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "time": "30m",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup cooked black beans",
    "1 cup mixed vegetables (bell peppers, onions, tomatoes)",
    "1/4 cup guacamole",
    "2 tablespoons salsa",
    "2 tablespoons olive oil",
    "1 teaspoon cumin",
    "1 teaspoon chili powder",
    "Salt and pepper to taste"
  ],
  "steps": [
    "Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).",
    "Rinse the mixed vegetables and chop them into bite-sized pieces. Place them on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with cumin and chili powder. Roast in the oven for 20 minutes or until tender.",
    "In a large bowl, mash the cooked black beans with a fork. Add the roasted vegetables, guacamole, and salsa. Mix well.",
    "Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.",
    "Garnish with additional guacamole and salsa if desired."
  ],
  "note": "This vegan Mexican platter is perfect for a quick and flavorful meal or as a snack. You can customize it to your taste by adding other vegan toppings such as sliced avocado, diced tomatoes, or chopped cilantro."
}
generated_recipes.dpo_recipe:
{
  "name": "Vegan Mexican Fiesta Platter",
  "cuisine": "Mexican",
  "culinary_preference": "vegan",
  "time": "30m",
  "main_ingredients": [
    "1 cup cooked black beans, drained and rinsed",
    "2 medium-sized bell peppers, diced",
    "1 medium-sized onion, diced",
    "1 medium-sized zucchini, diced",
    "1 avocado, diced",
    "1/2 cup guacamole",
    "1/4 cup salsa",
    "2 tablespoons lime juice",
    "1 teaspoon cumin",
    "1 teaspoon chili powder",
    "1/4 teaspoon paprika",
    "Salt and pepper to taste",
    "Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish"
  ],
  "steps": [
    "Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.",
    "In a large bowl, toss the bell peppers and onion with 1 tablespoon of lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/4 teaspoon chili powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Spread on the prepared baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes or until tender.",
    "In a separate pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes per side or until tender. Set aside.",
    "In a large bowl, combine the cooked black beans, roasted peppers and onion, cooked zucchini, diced avocado, and guacamole. Toss to combine.",
    "Warm the tortillas by wrapping them in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds.",
    "Assemble the platter by placing a portion of the bean and vegetable mixture onto a warmed tortilla, followed by a spoonful of salsa and a sprinkle of cilantro. Serve immediately."
  ]
}

      "Warm tortillas by wrapping them in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds.",

}
